title: Calories in Sake Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in sake wine per 100 ml serving, including carbs, alcohol content, full nutrition breakdown, and serving tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Dry sake wine, 15% ABV, room temperature, no added sugars or mixers; values approximate standard Japanese rice wine.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, sweetness level, and serving size; alcohol content affects calories. Consult labels for precision.

quick_answer.text: Sake wine contains about 105 kcal per 100 ml, mostly from alcohol and residual carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mixed with 50 ml soda water (diluted serving)
Hot sake (steamed, no calorie change but volume may vary)

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard glass of sake wine?
faqs.a: A typical 150 ml pour has about 158 kcal; adjust for serving size.
Yes, around 4.5 g carbs per 100 ml, mainly from rice fermentation.

faqs.q: What's the alcohol content in sake and how does it affect calories?
faqs.a: Usually 15-20% ABV; alcohol contributes ~7 kcal per gram, making up most calories.

faqs.q: Is sake wine low in fat or sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, 0 g fat and very low sodium (~5 mg per 100 ml) in plain sake.

faqs.q: How do calories in sake compare to other wines?
faqs.a: Similar to dry white wine at ~100-120 kcal per 100 ml, but sake has more carbs from rice.
